data.text:
Breastfeeding is not a one-woman job.

As Breastfeeding Week continues, @WHO shows how to support breastfeeding mothers anytime, anywhere: https://t.co/5htj8P0GaJ https://t.co/Z1i2yXXvhf

UN Peacekeepers #ServingForPeace with @unmissmedia renovated a nursery and a primary school in South Sudan, building additional classrooms and toilets for some 600 students: https://t.co/Mf2wXhGu9X https://t.co/G4LoEMOd4W

There are more than 1000 species of sharks & rays 🦈 - yet an increasing number are threatened with extinction.

Here's how you can help protect life below water: https://t.co/lPkG5mRntI #SharkWeek #GlobalGoals https://t.co/jFomJlMKak

Around 1600 people from Nepal go abroad to find a job every single day.

@ILO explains why almost half of all Nepali families rely on support from relatives abroad. https://t.co/6t6u6ZWyXf

July will likely be the hottest month ever recorded & it follows the warmest-ever June. We need urgent #ClimateAction now to avoid more extreme weather events & protect our planet & our future. More form @WMO: https://t.co/BZN3c722n5 https://t.co/KaBLuCXKFP

"Preventing irreversible climate disruption is the race of our lives and for our lives. It is a race we can – and must – win." -- @antonioguterres calling for urgent and ambitious #ClimateAction. https://t.co/Vn6VtSvUZO https://t.co/vAWJJFWtGT
Starting Thursday, follow #31DaysofYOUth to celebrate 1.8 billion young people around the 🌎 as the leaders of today & tomorrow! #GlobalGoals https://t.co/XtFZUaNeJ6 https://t.co/pR6dFepdAu

Watch live: @antonioguterres briefing the press on urgent need for #ClimateAction following recent heatwaves and more.
https://t.co/07irIwYOKf

170,000+ people vaccinated
1,300 people treated

1 year after start of latest Ebola outbreak in Democratic Republic of Congo, there has been much progress, but more needs to be done to combat the disease. https://t.co/RPxfW9oLAI via @WHO https://t.co/uHy8VRF1p9

"Without cooking sustainably, we can't preserve culture, we can't preserve food practices" -- Chef Michael @elegbede1m from Nigeria on why he joined the #ActNow food challenge. https://t.co/173EiYzPrz #ClimateAction https://t.co/cSmX34950o
Thursday: @PLinUN takes on rotating presidency of the Security Council for the month of August. https://t.co/SWOUn8Bhy9 https://t.co/vBWD1XB3Lp

🗹 Make your diet sustainable & diverse
🗹 Reduce food waste
🗹 Buy local

Get more #ClimateAction ideas for a #ZeroHunger 🌎 from @FAO : https://t.co/u1nnBdXqKL

World Breastfeeding Week starts Thursday.

@WHO explains how you can support breastfeeding: https://t.co/5htj8P0GaJ https://t.co/lVWGiTZk3N

Children make up about half the refugee population. 

5 things you should know about children & migration  ⬇️ https://t.co/qHRH23T9mz  via @UNMigration #ForMigration https://t.co/ljEDQjScXm

"Every day is very exciting and interesting." -- Lisa Filipetto on her job as head of @UNSOS_ in Somalia.

The UN is looking for more senior leaders like her to serve in @UNPeacekeeping. Details: https://t.co/zcraYF1R6a #GlobalCall2019 https://t.co/nI4AEW81RC

Record temperatures
Wildfires in the Arctic
Melting glaciers

More about the impacts of the July heatwave from @WMO: https://t.co/BZN3c722n5 #ClimateAction https://t.co/50j90jXTbP
Second Ebola case confirmed in Goma, Democratic Republic of Congo. @WHO and UN are working to stop any further spread of the disease. https://t.co/KNTDCrpGWK

By refusing single-use plastic items like bags, you can help #BeatPlasticPollution and take #ClimateAction for 🌊 #CleanSeas:  https://t.co/BX3YUyUI7n
https://t.co/yuB3GVmJhN

Choose respect.
Choose support.
Choose kindness.

@UNICEF shares some tips on how you can help #ENDviolence in schools: https://t.co/AUtLgabcwB https://t.co/tycCNKcRmA
Interested in a UN career? Wednesday is the last day to apply for the UN Young Professionals Programme. Details here: https://t.co/vY5EUPRBWv https://t.co/7siPS2CsKg

"The magnitude of the devastation and human suffering that I learned about and witnessed firsthand is difficult to comprehend." -- @UNDP's @ASteiner on his recent trip to Yemen. https://t.co/NryQNK0yf9

Syria: At least 450 civilians have been killed since late April – including more than a hundred in the last two weeks.

@UNReliefChief calls on Security Council to take urgent & immediate action to stop further attacks against civilians. https://t.co/YbeliOsnQx

Being kind is a powerful way to make our schools and communities safer. @BTS_twt is helping @UNICEF spread kindness to #EndViolence in schools. https://t.co/xAd4jsekG3

 https://t.co/YerFPaCc5S

Happy Birthday, Arnold @Schwarzenegger, and thank you for your commitment to protecting the environment!

Here is how you can join him in taking #ClimateAction today: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/bIZmRlQHEw

Children continue to bare the brunt of conflict around the world. In new report, @antonioguterres calls for increased protection for children and an immediate end to violations against them. https://t.co/YIJwoZshkw https://t.co/q6h2GYjRvE

On Tuesday's #FriendshipDay, we want to thank all #ClimateAction heroes for being great friends to our 🌏, especially @antonioguterres, our colleagues at @UNFCCC & @UNDP and many others in the UN family.

Here's how you can #ActNow to make a difference: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/varvtIY4eN

Criminals are using increasingly sophisticated methods, including exploiting social media, to contact & lure human trafficking victims. On Tuesday's #EndHumanTrafficking Day, find out from @UNODC how you can help stop this crime: https://t.co/wG5fChC45g https://t.co/OdwAyi1R3C

Friendship between peoples, countries, cultures & individuals can inspire peace
and build bridges between communities. https://t.co/n3HcQD009j #FriendshipDay https://t.co/EcRtx9sY7x

"Liberia is an inspiring example of what the best of humanity can offer to overcome some of the worst of what humanity can do. It is also testimony to the immense value of @UNPeacekeeping" -- @AminaJMohammed #ServingForPeace https://t.co/YuGswwcmBQ
On Tuesday's #FriendshipDay & every day, share the spirit of human solidarity & tell your friends you appreciate them! https://t.co/TiYWsTX55B https://t.co/xnQrA7FajB

Human trafficking happens around us, everywhere, every day. On Tuesday's #EndHumanTrafficking Day, find out what @UNODC is doing to stop this crime & how you can help: https://t.co/BGSS3QVMke https://t.co/dTUXvF29aj

The world has already used up more resources than can be renewed in 2019. That's why everyone needs to #ActNow to ensure sustainable consumption & production to protect our 🌎. https://t.co/be78xX9jo1 #EarthOverShootDay https://t.co/0I6FZnnoFs

Over the last century we have lost over 95% of the world’s tigers. Fewer than 3,800 🐯 remain in the wild in only 13 countries. Find out how you can help protect them: https://t.co/VZPCTtoUsa #InternationalTigerDay https://t.co/h6wudbO1uA

Some of the highest Himalayan peaks are melting & glacial lakes are at risk of bursting. @UNDP shows how sensors, canals & drainage equipment are protecting millions in the valleys below. https://t.co/g82gkt6dXD #ClimateAction 
https://t.co/rdwLySIQgj
Starts on Monday at @UNGeneva: Conference on Disarmament, 3rd part (through 13 September) : https://t.co/wxkB1OMAbb https://t.co/GAr59NwxZf

New "One Day, I Will" photo exhibit from @UNOCHA, showcasing the hopes and dreams of girls trapped in crises around the world, is opening at UNHQ in NYC on Monday. https://t.co/WhoaQyzTcQ https://t.co/MNHXPu1CYV
Happening this week: #FriendshipDay, #EndHumanTrafficking Day, World Breastfeeding Week & more. https://t.co/aOqF6cv967 https://t.co/itdUg1nmwn

Dire economic conditions

Insecurity

Lack of food, medicine

Around 4 million Venezuelans have fled their county.

Here's how @UN_Women is helping vulnerable women trying to start new lives in Colombia. https://t.co/F2eqjIfuBW

Meet the all-female anti-poaching unit @blackmambasapu. They have been protecting animals in Kruger National Park in South Africa since 2013. Their work has reduced poaching in the reserve by 75%. via @UNEnvironment https://t.co/YMH9OEyWsr

Using football as a tool for empowerment, a @UN_Women programme in Kenya is helping girls and women stand on their own feet & make their mark -- both on and off the field. #WomenInSport https://t.co/OqnJZau8h0

4 countries in 8 days – get a glimpse of what it’s like to travel with @antonioguterres, meeting people from around the globe while trying to make the world a better, more peaceful place for all. https://t.co/xgqs2hWHm7

The five main hepatitis viruses are type A, B, C, D & E.

On Sunday's #WorldHepatitisDay, find out the difference between them & how to protect yourself: https://t.co/v7ITS7aKNB https://t.co/1xAonGy1i4

For those living in isolated & vulnerable environments, knowing dangerous weather is approaching can be lifesaving information. @WFP is promoting technology & innovation to help protect people. https://t.co/yXgwH1hGgm
Hepatitis is preventable, treatable, and in the case of hepatitis C, curable. More from @WHO on Sunday's #WorldHepatitisDay: https://t.co/qfq8qx1RoO https://t.co/TqjrNQHmtU

Every day, there are 37,000 people forced to flee their homes.
Every day, we have 37,000 reasons to work for peace so they can go home.
More from @Refugees: https://t.co/XALPfBF85W #WithRefugees https://t.co/lUyOY4LavR

325 million people worldwide are living with hepatitis. But 80% have no access to testing & treatment. On Sunday's #WorldHepatitisDay, @WHO calls on countries to invest in eliminating hepatitis. https://t.co/qfq8qxjsNo https://t.co/GvO5JlXrmK
Lack of maternal care is forcing pregnant women to leave Venezuela in a bid to protect themselves & their unborn babies. @Refugees is supporting many at reception centres. https://t.co/08dD8yOGWG
Happy birthday to @UNDP Goodwill Ambassador & #GameOfThrones star @nikolajcw! Join the climate champion & take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/zTkumwgS40 https://t.co/IZMR4eaQLD

New @VisitUN garden tours offer a unique perspective of the history & architecture of UNHQ, as well as insight into the North Lawn art collection. Book your tour here: https://t.co/rtabGjDPSf #VisitUN https://t.co/MuWO1Apvy6

Each year, thousands of @UNVolunteers are working to support @UNpeacekeeping missions. They share their time & expertise with some of the world's most vulnerable people. #ServingForPeace
https://t.co/NUY6quW3X1

Despite significant progress in addressing the spread and treatment of HIV, around 37 million people worldwide are still living with the virus today. @WHO explains why the HIV epidemic is not over. https://t.co/mRwAogeacV
Choosing not-so-perfect fruits & vegetables helps economies, the environment and can contribute to #ZeroHunger 🌍. https://t.co/XL5XeRLaFr

"Intentional attacks against civilians are war crimes, and those who have ordered them or carried them out are criminally responsible for their actions.”  -- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet on airstrike casualties in Syria. https://t.co/rvhNl6LUkp

Only 1 in 5 people worldwide are protected from second-hand smoke in indoor public spaces & workplaces.

Only completely smoke-free environments fully protect people from this danger. https://t.co/OgBSLuvgwG #NoTobacco https://t.co/ns0OuhIH6X

The death penalty does little to serve victims or deter crime. 

170 countries have either abolished the death penalty or introduced a moratorium on its use. More from @UNHumanRights: https://t.co/xzffKwyFtm #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/uSugsVQvBA

Successful partnerships 🤝 between governments, the private sector & civil society are 🔑 for human security & achieving the #GlobalGoals. Find out more from the UN Trust Fund for Human Security: https://t.co/2E7Sn0U22j https://t.co/o5AOjYG2dV

Apply now through 5 August for your chance to take part in the Solutions Summit this September at UNHQ in NYC, where you can share your innovative ideas for achieving the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/OnWDrDQMhm https://t.co/HIm3IWWHqS
Mangroves contribute to the wellbeing, food security, and protection of coastal communities worldwide. Find out more on Friday's #MangroveDay: https://t.co/u8d81li13t https://t.co/sDIJGo0KRa
Desert locust outbreaks in Yemen & the Horn of Africa could further threaten food security & the well-being of local populations, warns @FAO. https://t.co/aFCHG5LoCa https://t.co/TicVkzU9NO

Mangroves are rare ecosystems on the boundary between land & sea. On Friday's #MangroveDay, find out from @UNESCO how mangroves can help address the climate crisis: https://t.co/u8d81l0qbV https://t.co/UQnvZ5dpEz

From breastfeeding support to childcare, family-friendly policies benefit working moms and the entire society. @UNICEF shares some tips for new moms planning their return to work. https://t.co/jBq5Lq8oat

The past 50 years has seen more heatwaves than ever before, and this trend will continue.
The climate crisis means heatwaves are expected to become longer, more frequent & intense: https://t.co/Hm71oE1Aoa  #ClimateAction
 https://t.co/ykMT1GYvAo

"I will continue the legacy of my predecessor, Ambassador Rhonda King, to make the whole ECOSOC as relevant & efficient as possible." -- @mona_juul, elected as new @UNECOSOC President on Thursday. Her bio: https://t.co/lpQsTn70Gz https://t.co/JycVYQySrS
World leaders signed up for an AIDS-free generation by 2030, but if we don’t walk the talk we might not get there, says @UNAIDS chief @CarlssonSwe. https://t.co/BRSb311p2Y
Eating less meat helps save water and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Get more #ClimateAction tips from #AngryBirdsHappyPlanet ➡️ https://t.co/zTkumwytsA https://t.co/t80JeXPm2C

"It gives me great satisfaction when I succeed in convincing someone who is suspected of having Ebola to go to the Ebola Treatment Centre for care." -- Dr Bah, @WHO epidemiologist in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. https://t.co/Qhj4jX9hsc https://t.co/we30Y1Ukxx
7,200+ @UNVolunteers from 161 countries worked with the UN last year. Here's how you can join @UNVolunteers: https://t.co/4AMomQA13p https://t.co/gCa2zma1uz
Nearly 9 million vulnerable families in Yemen are receiving emergency cash assistance from @UNICEF to help cover basic food, health and education needs. https://t.co/2OusVdvQGM

The @WorldBank's first ever 24-hour #Econothon is underway. Follow the discussion, as leading experts seek solutions for some of the biggest challenges facing our world today: https://t.co/1ptp9cG6fX #GlobalGoals https://t.co/qkjYwnjkjq

Switzerland
Sweden
USA
Netherlands
UK
Finland
Denmark
Singapore
Germany
Israel

Those are the top 10 innovators, according to the Global Innovation Index 2019: https://t.co/FzyjYO0pCT https://t.co/p2zU03FrQz

As rising temperatures create more unpredictable weather patterns, the world’s most vulnerable populations are hit hardest. @WFP explains how climate change has become one of the leading causes of hunger: https://t.co/mYuPDac0tV #ZeroHunger https://t.co/VfoaorqiV3

Around 4 million Venezuelans have fled dire economic conditions, insecurity, and the lack of food, medicine & essential services. Here's how @UN_Women is assisting vulnerable migrant women trying to start new lives in Colombia: https://t.co/F2eqjHXTdm

Simple steps can help you beat the heat when temperatures are on the rise:
➡️ Stay in the shade
➡️ Remain indoors during hottest times of the day
➡️ Drink plenty of water
➡️ Avoid strenuous activities

@WHO has more tips: https://t.co/1oyLAi2MO9 https://t.co/4Tay3phzeN

Many communities struggle with waste pick-up when they're not linked to public garbage collection systems. See how @UNHABITAT supports creative waste management solutions in Cameroon. https://t.co/ENJM3UgnVp https://t.co/TJrlIUvFTJ

Air pollution causes 7 million premature deaths each year, according to @WHO. New "Clean Air Initiative" calls on governments to commit to achieving air quality that is safe for citizens. https://t.co/a9hJpOgFWi #ClimateAction https://t.co/T1Sx878pkz
"We must work together to bring Israelis & Palestinians back to the negotiating table" -- @UNDPPA chief Rosemary DiCarlo tells Security Council. https://t.co/cNL4BBprlG https://t.co/HmvjpReXEg

#AngryBirdsHappyPlanet have taken over the #ActNow website to encourage everyone to make everyday choices that help protect our planet. 
Some ideas:
♻️ recycle
🍎 buy local produce
🥗 eat less meat
More 👉 https://t.co/zTkumwgS40 https://t.co/XAdJlDuFiT

"In light of the risks of abuse, maltreatment or death, no one should be returned to detention centres in Libya after being intercepted or rescued at sea" -- @IOMchief and @RefugeesChief. #WithRefugees #ForMigration https://t.co/IS95ZnUGqs

Companies have a crucial role to play in limiting global warming to 1.5°C. The @globalcompact has more on how businesses can take #ClimateAction to save #OurOnlyFuture: https://t.co/nrnSnNLIJw https://t.co/pUdiSn8fwg

A birth certificate is the key that can open the door to all other rights, such as health care & education. Yet, about 1 in 4 young children in the world haven't had their birth registered, according to @unicef. https://t.co/m5OkdIxiav https://t.co/j2lzMLi6AS

The departure of a @UNPeacekeeping mission is often a critical moment for countries on the path to ensure lasting peace. More on how this transition is taking shape in Haiti, where a new political mission is being established. https://t.co/iQ1Wi14KP9

“I want to be a farmer." - Dimiana's dream started in a school garden in a refugee camp in Kenya. @FAO is working to improve food security, nutrition & self-sufficiency through community gardens. https://t.co/IpVl83Oqgs #ZeroHunger

Are you interested in working for the UN?

Here are some tips for job interviews from @UN_Careers:
☑️ Prepare stories about your accomplishments
☑️ Be ready to discuss your ability to learn from experience
☑️ Listen to questions carefully

More info: https://t.co/J6VgGEYRTJ https://t.co/JY0NDTdkFu

Around 160,000 children between 0-14 years old were infected with HIV in 2018. @UNAIDS says that's a major decrease from 2010, but still well above target.  https://t.co/bzf09vG4lF https://t.co/FwmJjnsuMm
"Israel’s policy of destroying Palestinian property is not compatible with its obligations under international humanitarian law" -- statement on demolitions in the West Bank. https://t.co/m2EMmhpq1S

Cash assistance is providing a lifeline for 49,000+ Palestine refugees displaced in Syria. @UNOCHA explains how cash distribution is making a difference, particularly in the lives of women, children & the elderly. https://t.co/QpgcHlNFb9

Despite significant advances since 2010, progress in stopping new HIV infections and AIDS-related deaths has slowed down. Details from @UNAIDS: https://t.co/JHLip2fPlO #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Mf4rdMA8IY
Starts this week at @UNGeneva: Committee against Torture (through 9 August). Info & Documents here ➡️ https://t.co/Ui834cxRr4 https://t.co/a3cEn6pcyQ
Coming up this week: #WorldHepatitisDay & more. https://t.co/gQtGrteN0f https://t.co/se905cQUHB

.@UNICEF brought young people from around the 🌎 together to show how they are supporting the #GlobalGoals through their school projects & comics. See how you can take action: https://t.co/fXksYA7O1x https://t.co/7HVPuw3SH4

YOU have the power to respond to the climate emergency. Small changes in our habits can make a big difference if we all #ActNow. Join #AngryBirdsHappyPlanet and be part of the #ClimateAction movement: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/D13jleMmyj

Everyone has the right to seek asylum from persecution. 

Here's how @refugees works to protect those who need it: https://t.co/n4ejLcwGPE https://t.co/dZju2hg8oQ
Taking #ClimateAction is as easy cutting down your shower time to save water & energy. #ActNow and take simple steps for a healthier planet:  https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/gqhq7auFgL
The 🌏 came together at UNHQ in NYC to review progress towards achieving the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/tTGovAsx5x https://t.co/9hok8FNZ0x

Only 1 out of 10 people has access to free press in their country. @UNESCO highlights that access to information is essential for the achievement of the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/tKcHzOjce0 https://t.co/PKvLbX7IZz
The first 1,000 days of a child's life are critical for their future. @UNICEF shows how investing in early childhood development can help achieve the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/cy55VWAuXR

From Juba, South Sudan to NYC, people from around the 🌍 volunteered to help out in their communities during this week's #MandelaDay. More on the late South African leader's legacy: https://t.co/E079bDDUg6 https://t.co/9BW0eU9Db7

1 in 30 people in the world is a migrant - and they all deserve a life of dignity & safety. New Migration Fund will help countries with policy development & implementation to support Global Compact #ForMigration. https://t.co/nIZyY24y8J https://t.co/3rK047khRu

"The Holocaust did not start with the gas chambers - it started long before with hate speech." -- @UN_GP_RtoP's Adama Dieng on the dangers of hate speech. https://t.co/H9c8cu1iQL https://t.co/Dtp5J8gPtg

📷: This moon rock - brought back by Apollo 15 - is on display at @UNOOSA, which works to promote international cooperation in the peaceful use & exploration of space. https://t.co/QBfNBLz1wt #Apollo50 https://t.co/p8WUDAfES7
